titleStmt.title: Joint Kurdish-Assyrian Living in Iraqi Kurdistan: Reality and Challenges

analytic.title: Joint Kurdish-Assyrian Living in Iraqi Kurdistan: Reality and Challenges

biblStruct.note: In his contribution, the Assyrian priest, intellectual and NGO director Emanuel Youkhana gives an overview of the Kurdish Assyrian relationship in the autonomous region of Kurdistan in Iraq. He analyzes the language and educational situation as well as pol itical challenges arising from the division of the Nineveh Plains, which are heavily populated by Aramaic speaking Christians, between the Kurdistan Autonomous Region and the Iraqi government in Baghdad. In addition, different positions within the Assyrian communities are also critically discussed.

body.bibl: Youkhanna, Emmanuel. “Joint Kurdish-Assyrian Living in Iraqi Kurdistan: Reality and Challenges.” Wiener Jahrbuch Für Kurdische Studien 11 (2024 2023): 99–123.
Emmanuel Youkhanna, Joint Kurdish-Assyrian Living in Iraqi Kurdistan: Reality and Challenges, Wiener Jahrbuch Für Kurdische Studien 11 (2024 2023): 99–123.
